Research Consent Form
We invite you to participate in a research study being conducted by investigators from Washington University in St. Louis. We appreciate your interest in this study and thank you in advance for your contribution to our work! To participate, {{{b}}}please review the following information and indicate your consent by clicking the "Agree and Continue" button below{{{/b}}}. {{{br/}}}{{{br/}}} {{{b}}}{{{u}}}Study Objective{{{/u}}}{{{/b}}}: To learn more about behavior in organizations. Results will be used for academic purposes (e.g., publication in academic journals, conference presentations, etc.). {{{br/}}}{{{br/}}} {{{b}}}{{{u}}}Participation Details{{{/u}}}{{{/b}}}: If you agree to participate in this study, you will be asked to complete a 30-minute survey pertaining to your experience as a content creator; the entire study should take approximately 30 minutes. {{{br/}}}{{{br/}}} {{{b}}}{{{u}}}Data Collection{{{/u}}}{{{/b}}}: Surveys will be distributed through Qualtrics, the online survey program. The website is behind a firewall, and data will only be accessible by members of the research team who must provide password and user ID. Following the study, data will be downloaded and all individual identifiers (e.g. ID numbers) will be removed. {{{br/}}}{{{br/}}} {{{b}}}{{{u}}}Benefits from Results{{{/u}}}{{{/b}}}: Results will be used to help understand what influences employees’ experiences in the workplace. In addition, you will receive course credit for your participation. {{{br/}}}{{{br/}}} {{{b}}}{{{u}}}Risks{{{/u}}}{{{/b}}}: We do not anticipate more than a minimal level of risk to participating in this survey. Some individuals may find answering questions to be difficult or sensitive in nature; however, you are welcome to not answer these questions or to terminate the survey if you wish. {{{br/}}}{{{br/}}} {{{b}}}{{{u}}}Confidentiality{{{/u}}}{{{/b}}}: As soon as we have collected the data, any identifying information will be removed from the data. Your responses will be kept completely confidential by the study team and will only be shared after being averaged with responses from others (e.g. 43% of participants said...). Your individual responses will NOT be made available to anyone outside of the research team. {{{br/}}}{{{br/}}} {{{b}}}{{{u}}}Voluntary nature of participation{{{/u}}}{{{/b}}}: Your participation in this project is voluntary, and if you wish, you do not have to participate. Some questions may be sensitive, and you may decide to leave the study at any time by simply closing the Qualtrics website. You may also skip or refuse to respond to any survey question that you prefer not to answer.
Contact Information
If you have any questions about the research study itself, please contact Mac Strachan at m.j.strachan@wustl.edu. If you have questions, concerns, or complaints about your rights as a research participant, please contact the Human Research Protection Office at 1-(800)-438-0445 or email hrpo@wustl.edu. Thank you very much for your consideration of this research study.
Contact Information
Agree and Continue

Washington University in St. Louis Research Project
{{{h2}}}Study Background: Social Media Content Creation{{{/h2}}}{{{br/}}}{{{br/}}}{{{p}}}We are eager to learn more about your work as a {{{b}}}social media content creator{{{/b}}} or "influencer". We use the term {{{b}}}“Content Creator”{{{/b}}} to refer to individuals who are paid to create and share online content on social media platforms. Thus, even if you consider yourself to be an "influencer”, vlogger”, or some other label, we will use “Content Creator” as a general term to describe you. We use the term {{{b}}}“Content Creation”{{{/b}}} to refer to the activities you might engage in as you create your online content. This may include activities like recording, editing, posting, etc. {{{br/}}}{{{br/}}} We will be asking you to perform a sequence of activities that will help us understand the kinds of {{{b}}}day-to-day tasks{{{/b}}} your content creation work entails. {{{br/}}}{{{br/}}} As such, we ask that you please think of your {{{b}}}{{{u}}}most recent experiences{{{/u}}}{{{/b}}} with your {{{b}}}{{{u}}}content creation work{{{/u}}}{{{/b}}} as you respond to the questions. There are no wrong answers; we just want to learn more about your unique experience!{{{br/}}}{{{br/}}}{{{br/}}} {{{p}}}This study has {{{b}}}two steps{{{/b}}}:{{{br/}}}{{{b}}}First{{{/b}}}, we will ask you to complete an online activity to categorize the {{{b}}}day-to-day tasks{{{/b}}} you perform as a {{{b}}}social media content creator{{{/b}}}.{{{br/}}}{{{b}}}Second{{{/b}}}, we will ask you to answer some questions about your {{{b}}}background and experiences{{{/b}}} as a content creator. {{{br/}}}{{{b}}}Monetary payment will be awarded only to those who pass at least two attention checks to the study. Please pay close attention to the profiles.{{{/b}}}{{{/p}}}
Welcome!
Thank you for participating in this Research Project. Please take your time to carefully read the instructions on the next page. When you are ready, click the "{{{b}}}Continue{{{/b}}}" button at the bottom right side of the screen to go to the next step.

{{{h2}}}Study Background: Social Media Content Creation{{{/h2}}}{{{br/}}}{{{br/}}}{{{p}}}We are eager to learn more about your work as a {{{b}}}social media content creator{{{/b}}} or "influencer". We use the term {{{b}}}“Content Creator”{{{/b}}} to refer to individuals who are paid to create and share online content on social media platforms. Thus, even if you consider yourself to be an "influencer”, vlogger”, or some other label, we will use “Content Creator” as a general term to describe you. We use the term {{{b}}}“Content Creation”{{{/b}}} to refer to the activities you might engage in as you create your online content. This may include activities like recording, editing, posting, etc. {{{br/}}}{{{br/}}} We will be asking you to perform a sequence of activities that will help us understand the kinds of {{{b}}}day-to-day tasks{{{/b}}} your content creation work entails. {{{br/}}}{{{br/}}} As such, we ask that you please think of your {{{b}}}{{{u}}}most recent experiences{{{/u}}}{{{/b}}} with your {{{b}}}{{{u}}}content creation work{{{/u}}}{{{/b}}} as you respond to the questions. There are no wrong answers; we just want to learn more about your unique experience!{{{br/}}}{{{br/}}}{{{br/}}} {{{p}}}This study has {{{b}}}two steps{{{/b}}}:{{{br/}}}{{{b}}}First{{{/b}}}, we will ask you to complete an online activity to categorize the {{{b}}}day-to-day tasks{{{/b}}} you perform as a {{{b}}}social media content creator{{{/b}}}.{{{br/}}}{{{b}}}Second{{{/b}}}, we will ask you to answer some questions about your {{{b}}}background and experiences{{{/b}}} as a content creator. {{{br/}}}{{{b}}}Monetary payment will be awarded only to those who pass at least two attention checks to the study. Please pay close attention to the profiles.{{{/b}}}{{{/p}}}

Step 2. Statement Evaluation
{{{p}}}In this step, we will ask you about the specific {{{b}}}day-to-day tasks{{{/b}}} you perform as a {{{b}}}social media content creator{{{/b}}}. Please take your time and answer thoughtfully. There are no right or wrong answers, just be honest. {{{br/}}}{{{br/}}} {{{h3}}}Instructions:{{{/h3}}}{{{br/}}}Tap on the appropriate button to assign a value to each statement. {{{br /}}}{{{br /}}} If you feel that the statement is {{{b}}}similar to your perspective{{{/b}}}, tap the green "+" button.{{{br /}}}{{{br /}}} If you feel that the statement is {{{b}}}different from your perspective{{{/b}}}, tap the red "-" button. {{{br /}}}{{{br /}}}If you are unsure, tap the "?" button. {{{br /}}}{{{br /}}} There are {{{b}}}30 statements{{{/b}}} in this survey. {{{br /}}}{{{br /}}} If you want to {{{b}}}change{{{/b}}} your evaluation, tap the {{{b}}}redo icon{{{/b}}} next to the statement.
Evaluate the statements according to how {{{b}}}central{{{/b}}} or {{{b}}}important{{{/b}}} they are to your content creation work.

Refine Your Evaluations
During this stage you will be asked to {{{b}}}{{{/b}}}review the statements{{{/b}}} you evaluated and choose those that are most similar or most different from your perspective.{{{br/}}}{{{br/}}}You may need to {{{b}}}scroll down{{{/b}}} to see all of the statements.{{{br/}}}{{{br/}}}To {{{b}}}select a statement{{{/b}}}, tap on the statement container. The color of the statement will change to yellow.{{{br/}}}{{{br/}}}When you have selected the {{{b}}}correct number{{{/b}}} of statements, the "Submit" button will change to {{{b}}}blue{{{/b}}}. {{{br/}}}{{{br/}}}To make it easier to compare the statements, you can {{{b}}}reorder{{{/b}}} them by tapping on the up and down arrows located on the right or left sides of the statement.{{{br/}}}{{{br/}}}You can also {{{b}}}move a group{{{/b}}} of selected statements to the top of the list by {{{b}}}long pressing{{{/b}}} (about 1 second) on the arrows on the right a statement.

Stage 3 of 5{{{br/}}} Final Statement Ranking
The statements have been ranked based on your previous evaluations.{{{br/}}}{{{br/}}} Those statements that are closest to your perspective should be at the top of the list. Those that are farthest from your perspective should be at the bottom of the list.{{{br/}}}{{{br/}}}You will need to {{{b}}}scroll down{{{/b}}} to see all of the statements.{{{br/}}}{{{br/}}}Please {{{b}}}review the rankings{{{/b}}} and make any necessary changes to the ranking of the statements so that the ordering {{{b}}}accurately reflects your perspective{{{/b}}}. {{{br/}}}{{{br/}}}{{{mark}}}This is the most critical stage of the survey, so please review the statement rankings carefully.{{{/mark}}}{{{br/}}}{{{br/}}} To {{{b}}}swap the positions of neighboring statements{{{/b}}}, tap the up or down arrows on the right or left side of the statement.{{{br/}}}{{{br/}}}To {{{b}}}swap the positions of statements that are separated{{{/b}}}, tap on two statements (the statement color will change to yellow) and a swap confirmation message will appear.{{{br/}}}{{{br/}}}When you are satisfied with all of the rankings, tap the navigation button on the bottom right.
